articles.title: React Performance Optimization Techniques
articles.excerpt: Learn how to optimize React applications for better performance using modern techniques and best practices.
articles.content:
Performance optimization is crucial for creating smooth user experiences in React applications. Let's explore some key techniques.

Using React.memo

React.memo is a higher-order component that prevents unnecessary re-renders by memoizing the component output.

const MyComponent = React.memo(({ data }) => {
  return 
{data.title}
;
});

TanStack Query for Data Fetching

TanStack Query (formerly React Query) provides excellent caching and state management for server data.

const { data, isLoading } = useQuery({
  queryKey: ['todos'],
  queryFn: fetchTodos
});

These techniques can significantly improve your application's performance and user experience.

articles.title: From Figma Design to Production Code
articles.excerpt: A practical guide on converting Figma designs into clean, maintainable React components.
articles.content:
Translating designs from Figma to code is a crucial skill for frontend developers. Here's my workflow.

Understanding the Design System

Before writing any code, I analyze the Figma file to identify reusable components, color tokens, and spacing patterns.

Component Breakdown

I break down complex designs into smaller, reusable components. This makes the code more maintainable and follows React best practices.

// Example component structure
const Card = ({ title, description, image }) => (
  

    
    
{title}

    
{description}

  

);

This systematic approach ensures pixel-perfect implementation while maintaining code quality.

articles.title: TailwindCSS Best Practices for Scalable Projects
articles.excerpt: Essential tips and patterns for using TailwindCSS effectively in large-scale applications.
articles.content:
TailwindCSS is powerful, but it requires discipline to keep your codebase maintainable. Here are my best practices.

Custom Configuration

Always customize your tailwind.config.js to match your design system. This ensures consistency across the project.

module.exports = {
  theme: {
    extend: {
      colors: {
        primary: '#14b8a6',
        secondary: '#6366f1'
      }
    }
  }
}

Component Extraction

Extract repeated utility combinations into components to avoid duplication and improve readability.

"Utility-first doesn't mean you can't create components." - Adam Wathan

Following these practices will help you build scalable, maintainable applications with Tailwind.
